website_summaries.verdict: For hikers in search of a Danner boot that bursts with loads of comfort, the Crag Rat is for them. This great-fitting footgear is also for those who need fantastic arch support and waterproofing in their day-long escapades. The one thing that many might find a real downer concerning this hiking boot, however, is its towering price tag. Nonetheless, the Danner Crag Rat is a shining example of a boot done right thanks to its magnificent collection of positives.
pros: Reviewers in droves, including a couple of professional ones, deemed the Crag Rat’s ankle support superbly dependable
This Danner boot was applauded by many users for being exceptionally waterproof
Quite a number of wearers found the confines of this hiker remarkably comfortable
Based on several reports, the Danner Crag Rat runs true to size
Its lightness amazed a small group of testers
The excellent durability of this footgear floored a couple of shoe pundits
A few owners fell in love with the boot’s outstanding surface traction
cons: A tiny fraction of the reviewing community wished that the Crag Rat had more than one colorway
Its steep asking price disappointed one footwear critic

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason for purchasing this product is it was not made in China. The fit was perfect with no breaking-in needed. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run small, very narrow toebox.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. Well constructed. Great arch support. They run small and the toebox is way too narrow. Disappointing coming from Danner. I've been wearing their boots for over 20 years and consistent sizing was one of the biggest appeals.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing build quality👍🏼Narrow toe box👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing, know that these boots are designed for extremely rocky and steep terrain. They are very very stiff and take a lot of time to break in. They are perfect for the terrain they are made for. The build quality is superb and I have had no water penetrate the Gore-Tex. My only complaint is the sizing. The toe box is abnormally narrow. After reading plenty of reviews about the narrow sizing, I preemptively ordered extra wides which were still uncomfortably narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Narrow and small
customer_reviews.text: This boots is small and narrow.Cushion is nice,but toe is narrow.So if you buy this boots you should choose one more bigger size. I have Belleville desert boots that size is 10W but this boots 10W is narrow to me. So, I should buy 11W or 11.5W. Generally this hiking boots makes small so if you wanna wear comfortably you should buy more 1inch or 1.5inch up size one.
customer_reviews.author: Tamio Nishizawa

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite Danners
customer_reviews.text: I have had at least 11 pairs of various Danner shoes/boots (that I can think of), some made in USA and others not. I love most of them. These however, weren't quite the quality I expect from Danner USA boots. The toe box is quite large and the tongue is so thick and wide that it's difficult to lace through the hook eyelets. Basically the tongue doesn't fit very well into the shaft so I have to squish it down to where it's somewhat uncomfortable just to lace it. On a good note, the construction and material are solid. Hopefully the tongue problem gets better over time. I definitely recommend Danner overall, but these not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot just not for my type of work
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy, comfortable, well made, however flexability for the type of work performed left stress cracks and seperation in sole so ended up getting a more flexable work boot. But otherwise they were a good boot.
customer_reviews.author: wendee morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Order a size larger
customer_reviews.text: I own other Danners in this size and fit for size and width. These boots were a size too small.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Fit and product quality
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 12 for boots. If there had been a size 12.5, I would have exchanged them for the correct size. I returned them due to the perceived quality of the construction of the boot...it just did not lace up well either and the leather did not seem “correct. That said, I am a fan of Danner products, these boots just didn’t do it for me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Golden rule
customer_reviews.text: Hello Great looking boots Pull on loop on top of rear of boots Is To small..!!!!!!! Why???????? I admit it's not needed on this style of boot But $300 boots made in Portland Or And your to cheap of a company to make the loop big enough to put one finger through it Why.......??????? Why put it on the boots Disappointed in Idaho James
customer_reviews.author: James m.

customer_reviews.title: the fit
customer_reviews.text: Could not lace boots comfortably for excess leather on each side of tongue. Overwhelmed that DANNER made a very expensive high end boot of this nature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Built Boot
customer_reviews.text: The boot is quality with two different types of leather use to provide comfort. The heal of the boot is different and takes one to get use too.
customer_reviews.author: Hermies Hermits

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to doing some serious mileage in this boot. The design of the tongue made it impossible to snug the boot around the forefoot, and it wouldn’t close inside the boot at the top, thus interfering with fit around the ankle. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick Harvey Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great boot! A little on the narrow side but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boot! A little on the narrow side but overall a great looking boot! Have almost completely broken in after a mile or so on the trail
customer_reviews.author: Antonio S Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Boot tongue is way too big.
customer_reviews.text: Boot tongue is waaay too big causing it to bulge outside the boot. Un slightly and uncomfortable. It looks like it is not cut or stiched correctly to fold into the boot. Unacceptable for a boot at any price let alone as much as these cost. Pisses me off when my time gets wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. I spent 23 years in the Marines and have work a lot of boots, both military and civilian. These rank among the best I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Tron Beaker

customer_reviews.title: Runs narrow, buy a size up
customer_reviews.text: Got them and thank god i Got the wides. Comfy boots out of the box, pretty stiff but thats to be expected until broken in. But even the wides feel a little snug in the toe box. Do yourself a favor and buy a size up and wide!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Farabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Fit just fine if purchased them  WIDE
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews about them being a size too small . I normally wear a size 9 with that in mind , I purchased these boots ina size 9 wide . They fit just fine . .
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Sole separation
customer_reviews.text: Sole separated from the upper after only two weeks of hunting. Danner made it right quickly, but I did expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend if doing any real hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff out of the box but broke in quickly. I put about 15 miles on them in a little over a week they are still stiff but very supportive. Highly recommend if doing any real hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Owens

customer_reviews.title: Made for narrow feet.
customer_reviews.text: The arch in the boot cuts into the middle of my arch. It is quite painful, and is something that does not go away with time. Be forewarned, if you have wide feet, order a wide! Unfortunately, that size is hard to come by and people are scalping....$500 +
customer_reviews.author: Jay

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Crag Rat USA 6" Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Heavy duty backpacking boot made in the usa with imported components
feature_bullets: Cushioning open-cell OrthoLite footbed. D-ring hardware with double hook for custom lacing
Danner DRS platform to help support heavy loads
Vibram Tsavo outsole provides superior grip on rugged, high-elevation terrain
